text: Värendsvallen is a multi-purpose stadium in Växjö, Sweden. It is currently used mostly for football matches and was the home stadium of Östers IF until September 2012. The stadium currently holds 15,062 people and was built in 1966. The highest attendance ever was 26,404 against IK Brage in 1967, in the qualifying game for Allsvenskan. The following season, Öster averaged an attendance of 15,622 on their road to the club's first Swedish Championship. On March 31, 2011 work started on Myresjöhus Arena, the stadium was opened in September 2012 and replaced Värendsvallen as Östers home ground. Värendsvallen will be transformed into an athletics arena. ==External links== Category:Football venues in Sweden Category:Sport in Växjö Category:Multi- purpose stadiums in Sweden Category:Östers IF Category:Buildings and structures in Kronoberg County Category:Sports venues completed in 1966 Category:1966 establishments in Sweden
title: Värendsvallen
